column4: i wanna install X on my server what is the commad to get install it
sudo aptitude install xserver-xorg
do you want gnome installed?
do you want the full ubuntu desktop and software?  or just some basic gnome stuff?
I would suggest 'sudo aptitude install gdm xserver-xorg gnome'
it didn't install any packages?
are they already installed?
try the command startx
hm... try sudo aptitude install ubuntu-desktop
any luck?
what kind of message are you getting?
try entering 'dpkg -l gdm'
with the older version i insatalled the ubuntu-desktop and worked perfect ....any new ideas
w/o the quotes
that is a lowercase L
without the quotes
dpkg -l gdm
at a terminal, please enter "dpkg -l gdm" without the quotation marks around that command
that will show if the "gdm" package is installed
what is in your apt-sources list?
sorry, i have to go.  :(  if you need further help, try asking in #ubuntu-server
I hope it works for you!!  :)
